person_448.name: DiodorusSiculus
person_448.description: Of Sicily was an ancient Greek historian. He is known for writing the monumental universal history Bibliotheca historica, in forty books, fifteen of which survive intact, between 60 and 30 BCE.

person_466.name: WilliamPryce
person_466.description: Cornish medic and mine owner who wrote Mineralogia Cornubiensis (1778).

person_508.name: Lucretius
person_508.description: Roman poet and philosopher. His only known work is the materialist philosophical poem De rerum natura.

person_035.name: Homer
person_035.description: Homer was a Greek poet who is believed to have written the epic poems, the Iliad and the Odyssey.

person_470.name: Johann FriedrichHenckel
person_470.description: Prussian physician, chemist, metallurgist, and mineralogist.

person_387.name: John JoachimBecher
person_387.description: German physician and alchemist. Davy gives him incorrect dates in notebook 15E.

person_149.name: CharlesHatchett
person_149.description: He made his money from coach building which he used to pursue his interests in chemistry and mineralogy in the course of which he isolated the chemical element now called niobium. He was a Manager of the Royal Institution, playing a key role especially in running its lecture programme during the 1800s. FRSL.

person_125.name: JamesHutton
person_125.description: Scottish geologist, agriculturalist and chemical manufacturer. His Theory of the Earth (1795) is one of the foundations of modern geology. Davy discussed Hutton's theories in his lectures and visited some of the key geological sites that Hutton used in his work.

person_394.name: BenjaminFranklin
person_394.description: Man of science born in Philadelphia. Inventor, printer, publisher, political philosopher, and a Founding Father of the United States. FRSL.

person_036.name: IsaacNewton
person_036.description: Prominent English natural philosopher and mathematician greatly admired by Davy who once under the influence of several litres of nitrous oxide wrote in his notebook 'Davy & Newton' in one inch letters. FRSL.

place_013.name: St Michael's Mount
place_013.description: St Michael's Mount is a tidal island in Mount's Bay, Cornwall, with a distinct conical shape.

place_021.name: Cornwall
place_021.description: Cornwall is a county in south-west England, birthplace of Humphry Davy.

place_306.name: Alston Moor
place_306.description: A civil parish in Cumbria, England, based around the small town of Alston.

place_415.name: Fal, Fars
place_415.description: High Force is a waterfall on the River Tees, near Middleton-in-Teesdale, Teesdale, England.

place_247.name: Alps
place_247.description: The Alps are the highest and most extensive mountain range that lies entirely in Europe. They are located in eight European countries.

place_1008.name: Transylvania
place_1008.description: Transylvania is a historical and cultural region in Central Europe, encompassing central Romania.

place_044.name: Wicklow
place_044.description: County Wicklow is a county in Ireland on the east coast, south of Dublin.

place_461.name: Anglesey
place_461.description: Anglesey is an island, and county, on the north-west coast of Wales.

place_085.name: Derbyshire
place_085.description: Derbyshire is a county in the East Midlands and includes part of the Peak District.

place_121.name: England
place_121.description: England is a country that is part of the United Kingdom. It is located on the island of Great Britain, of which it covers approximately 62%, and over 100 smaller adjacent islands.

place_447.name: Dolgellau
place_447.description: Dolgellau is a town in the county of Gwynedd, north Wales.

place_1009.name: Redruth
place_1009.description: a town and civil parish in Cornwall

place_990.name: Siberia
place_990.description: a vast Russian province encompassing most of Northern Asia, with terrain spanning tundra, coniferous forest and mountain ranges

place_878.name: United States
place_878.description: The U.S. is a country of 50 states covering a vast swath of North America, with Alaska in the northwest and Hawaii extending the nationâ€™s presence into the Pacific Ocean.

place_1025.name: Elis
place_1025.description: a historic region in the western part of the Peloponnese peninsula of Greece, also known as Ilia.

place_1026.name: Olympia
place_1026.description: a small town in Elis on the Peloponnese peninsula in Greece, famous for the nearby archaeological site of the same name.

place_1027.name: Hungary
place_1027.description: a landlocked country in Central Europe. Its capital, Budapest, is bisected by the Danube River.

place_1028.name: Argyll
place_1028.description: a historic county and registration county of western Scotland.

place_079.name: Cumberland
place_079.description: Cumberland is a historic county in the far north-west of England.

place_1359.name: Northumberland
place_1359.description: County in the North East of England. It borders Scotland to the north and the county of Cumbria to the west.

place_1029.name: Durham, England
place_1029.description: a city in northeast England, south of Newcastle upon Tyne.

place_1030.name: Kongsberg
place_1030.description: a historical mining town and municipality in Buskerud county, Norway.

otherwork_115.name: The Prophecy of Famine. A Scots Pastoral
otherwork_115.author: Charles Churchill
